channel.title: miljko tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from miljko.

item.description: Zeynep Tufekci on missed opportunities: https://t.co/JbGuwO4kRu
Alan Jacobs on science and politics: https://t.co/GSOxPj8XAo
“Whatever its flaws, the NBA is one of the more functional institutions in American society.” Yes! And Jokić is the MVP. https://t.co/Slcty5qHPt
The Good Science Project is underselling how good it is. More like this, please. (signatures below the manifesto are a good — heh — example of quality over quantity) https://t.co/f3XNOC9uyn

Beats any journal club you’ll see this year. Ivo+aza is a devious study, conducted only outside the US for the express purpose of not having to deal with appropriate control arms and post-protocol Rx. Should not be used for US FDA approval. Then again, it doesn’t need it! Devious https://t.co/XzZCEs8wJb
Correction: 2 US locations. Out of 89 total. I'm sure the 2.2% of locations will translate into meaningful representation of all Americans. https://t.co/WllnUBsNbE

@Brian_Stoffel_ @nntaleb Also the reason for the “Florida man” meme, which is the consequence of the state’s Sunshine Act making all police reports available to the media. No such law in California, no California man.
@aledeniz That's the one I ordered! https://t.co/Pzo36t7VR0
@Kimi83Matija Available in Serbia? Online ordering? Will try to have someone bring it over the next time they're visiting.
@Timothee_MD Heh, thanks! :)
@aledeniz Thanks! I didn't know about Sarelle until today, but there's a shipment on its way from Turkey now
@trishankkarthik Still better than some American spreadables! https://t.co/Vtbr7Gy7uh
@trishankkarthik More chocolate or more cocoa? The top 3 layers + some of the sugar are all chocolate :)
@AaronGoodman33 “As seen in The Complete Idiot’s Guide to Making a Billion-Dollar Drug.”
Twitter-friendly controversies: https://t.co/LFopIuEzwd
Well this is a surprise. I expected way more sugar and only trace amounts of hazelnut. https://t.co/L8SES0IemI
Debates I'd rather avoid: https://t.co/nlpVdzRbp5

@rationalwalk @stratechery Interesting that the two came out on the same day. Hope @benthompson comments on The Atlantic article in an update. Would separating social graphs from timeline algorithms and APIs help?

@zamishka @barttels2 My reading was that US democracy functioned for so long because of systems created to temper mass man’s worst instincts. Systems which we’ve been short-circuiting for the last 10+ years. So yes, it’s a core problem in a way water being wet is a core problem of needing an umbrella
@zamishka @barttels2 Why do you say that? Most of America isn’t on Twitter, and most Twitter users aren’t part of pileups. I must have misunderstood what you meant by “mass men”.

@zamishka @barttels2 Why are mass man’s motives the core problem rather than non-mass people’s (“the exhausted majority”’s) reaction to the mass? The article had some sensible suggestions on how to improve things. A bit more pie-in-the-sky but still good is today’s Stratechery https://t.co/MYQkLhXutl
The most important article you'll read this week: https://t.co/tRo6TnzHGx
@ArtirKel Thanks for sharing this, it’s on my watch list now. Any chance they mention lack of theoretical biology? I.e. if physics were also only experimental, would we consider it just as fuzzy?
From David Graeber’s uneven but in parts excellent book BS Jobs. This was my own conclusion after watching that CGP Gray video on AI taking over all the jobs some years back 📚 https://t.co/qNQRjf5dJa

“We live in Applicatia, a world where people must spend their days improving their resumes in the hope of improving their lives…” This is from Experimental History, my new favorite newsletter. https://t.co/SbFG0Fn3o0
🎙 Out of the two podcasts about randomized controlled trials that came out this week, I much preferred this one. Confirmation bias. https://t.co/AEn82oFCJW
